gloss: American Revolutionary leader and pamphleteer (born in England) who supported the American colonist's fight for independence and supported the French Revolution (1737-1809) / a degree conferred to honor the recipient / a group of three men responsible for public administration or civil authority / a language unit by which a person or thing is known / a title that Leo X bestowed on Henry VIII and later withdrew; parliament restored the title and it has been used by English sovereigns ever since / a title used to address any British peer except a duke and extended to a bishop or a judge / a word that is more specific than a given word / a word that names a part of a larger whole / assign a new name to / being of or having to do with the northern United States and those loyal to the Union during the American Civil War / give a nickname to / give a title to / of or having to do with the southern Confederacy during the American Civil War / someone who holds a government position (either by election or appointment) / the person who holds the position of head of the government in the United Kingdom
holding first place in a contest
a degree conferred to honor the recipient
